bib_record.title: Photoneutron cross sections for oxygen from 24 - 133 MeV.

free_txt: The detection process permits the measurement of
the photoneutron multiplicity "I" and therefore the
simultaneous and independent measurement of each
partial inclusive photoneutron cross section
sig(g,in) for each value of photon energy Eg.
The inclusive partial photoneutron cross section
sig(g,1n...) and sig(g,2n...), and the total
photoneutron cross section sig(eg) = sum(sig(g,in))
for O-16 have been measured with monoenergetic
photons in the energy range above the giant
resonance and below the meson thresholds. The
measured integrated total photoneutron cross section
up to 140 mev is 0.67(0.07) TRK sum-rule units.
4PI detector: 250 l of gadolinium-loaded
liquid scintillator.
The errors presented are resulted from the
combination in quadrature of the purely
statistical uncertanties of the photoneutron
counting rates (including background subtraction),
the mostly statistical uncertainties related to
photon beam, and the mostly systematic uncertainties
associated with the neutron-detector efficiency.
The energy resolution was about 10(2)%.
Water target of 7 g/cm**2 thick
